properties.Name: StoreProductQuantityRangePriceList
properties.Description:
The Price List specific to a Quantity Range for a Product as defined for a Store for a specific period.

This is usually for a short-term sale or special.

For example: 
Regular Price represented in STORE PRODUCT PRICE LIST is 1.99.
Sale price is 0.99 for the first 3 items purchased, and 1.49 thereafter during the sales period.

Columns.Name: StoreId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Store.

Columns.Name: ProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: PriceListTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Price List Type.

Columns.Name: PricingUomId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: MinimumQuantity
Columns.Description: The minimum quantity for which the price is applicable.

Columns.Name: MaximumQuantity
Columns.Description: The maximum quantity for which the price is applicable.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartTimestamp
Columns.Description:
The period start timestamp for which the Product Quantity Range Price List is defined. This is usually for a short-term sale or special.

Note: Timestamp is used rather than Date to accommodate situations where the product price can vary throughout the day.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndTimestamp
Columns.Description:
The period end timestamp for which the Product Quantity Range Price List is defined. This is usually for a short-term sale or special.

Note: Timestamp is used rather than Date to accommodate situations where the product price can vary throughout the day.

Columns.Name: SuggestedRetailPrice
Columns.Description:
The Standard, or default, price charged by retailers to the public for the Product.

The price of a Product published in a catalog, advertisement or printed list from which discounts, if any, may be subtracted. 

This is the price that normally appears in catalogs, on purchase orders and invoices.

Columns.Name: ListPrice
Columns.Description:
The Standard retail price of the Product before the application of any discount.

The price of a Product published in a catalog, advertisement or printed list from which discounts, if any, may be subtracted. 

This is the price that normally appears in catalogs, on purchase orders and invoices.

Columns.Name: TargetReturnPrice
Columns.Description:
A price established as part of a strategy to yield a specific return on investment.

Target-Return Price = (unit cost) + ((desired return)*(invested capital))/unit sales

The Target-Return Price ignores competitor's pricing and price elasticity.

Columns.Name: StandardCost
Columns.Description: The estimated or calculated cost to manufacture or produce the Product.

Columns.Name: MarginAmount
Columns.Description: The difference between the price of a Product and the cost to produce it.

Columns.Name: BreakEventPointAmount
Columns.Description:
Identifies the relationship between a Product's fixed and variable costs and revenue-profits based on the number of products sold or "how many units must be sold to make a profit".

Break Even Point = (Fixed Cost/(Unit Price - Unit Variable Cost))

Example:

A company invests $250,000 (fixed costs) into developing a new Product that sells for $10 per Product.   Variable costs are determined to be $5 per unit.

The Break Even Point is 50,000.    50,000 products must be sold for the company to recover its investment and begin to realize profits.

Properties.Description:
The Price List specific to a Quantity Range for a Product as defined for a Store for a specific period.

This is usually for a short-term sale or special.

For example: 
Regular Price represented in STORE PRODUCT PRICE LIST is 1.99.
Sale price is 0.99 for the first 3 items purchased, and 1.49 thereafter during the sales period.
